thread.title: The Internet Blows Up Over GOP Rep’s Tweet About Immigration
thread.title_full: The Internet Blows Up Over GOP Rep’s Tweet About Immigration

author: Scott Greer
title: The Internet Blows Up Over GOP Rep’s Tweet About Immigration
text:
— Peter Brack (@peterbrack) March 12, 2017 @JordanUhl @oppstn Genocide is in the wind. Even the Nazis were not this blatant in Hitler's first 6 years in power. 
— PWM (William) (@PWM62) March 12, 2017 mmm that great white supremacist taste https://t.co/tn7PXOzXfU 
— Jamelle Bouie (@jbouie) March 12, 2017 Rep. Steve King is not under fire. He is a racist. The Devil lives in flames. pic.twitter.com/j8HXXOXxKi 
— Terrell J. Starr (@Russian_Starr) March 12, 2017 GOP Congressman @SteveKingIA promotes the un-American ideas of white nationalism. Will any Republican congressmen condemn his bigotry? https://t.co/5etQ8fwZx2 
— Evan McMullin (@Evan_McMullin) March 12, 2017 
The liberal outlet Slate declared King’s tweet is “an apparent, explicit call to protect white ‘culture and demographics’ from immigrants. It’s the type of rhetoric that you might find at a Klan rally.” 
At least one fellow Republican lawmaker has criticized King’s comment. Florida Rep. Carlos Curbelo, who is Cuban-American, wondered if he counted as “someone else’s baby” in a reply to the Iowa congressman’s tweet. . @SteveKingIA What exactly do you mean? Do I qualify as "somebody else's baby?" #concernedGOPcolleague 
— Carlos Curbelo (@carloslcurbelo) March 13, 2017 
King is a well-known immigration hawk who has been criticized in the past for his remarks on the subject. During an MSNBC panel last July, the lawmaker was called a racist for pushing back against a fellow panelist’s joy that “old white people” are going away and arguing for the greatness of western civilization. (RELATED: Media Paints Steve King As Racist For Defending Western Civilization)
